titleStmt.title: William Hipwell to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7302

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
CITY OF LOUISVILLE
PROGRESS
KENTUCKY
Mayor's Office,
Louisville, Ky., Novr 6th 1865
His Excellency Gov. Thos E. Bramlett of the State of Ky,,
Sir

I have the honour to enclose the petition of Mary Ryan. this woman was fined $60000 in the city court of this city -- Your Excellency on a former occasion remited $30000 of said fine. Since which She has paid $10000 the receipt for which I enclose also, this woman has Kept her House as regular as any of her class of Houses and in my opinion more So. and I pass those houses day and night, besides $10000 is more than Some of the Keepers of first class houses have been fined I have reason to believe that the payment of the remaining $20000 would about begger this woman who was thus heavily fined more from prejudice than desert -- as an officer of
the city cognisant of the character of all Such Houses I would in spirit of justice and humanity recomend to your Excellency the remittance of the remainder of this womans fine

I am Sir
Very respectfully
Your obt Serv't
Wm Hipwell
Lieut of Police
